text: this is David Kirkpatrick reporting from
Tripoli for the New York Times today we
visited the city of beni Waleed which is
the homeland of the waffle a tribe the
largest tribe in Libya the big surprise
was that the Qadhafi government has been
living up to its promise to arm the
population the residents there said
every household had been given a new
coalition a cough in the last few days
and we saw men middle-aged women and
teenage boys showing off their weapons
some firing them recreationally into the
air this struck me as a bold gesture of
confidence on Colonel Gaddafi's part
because of course in this kind of a
country it's hard to really know just
how much support he has among any part
of the population since there's so many
incentives to demonstrate enthusiastic
support no matter how you feel and on
the way back in we noticed that look at
off he forces it set up several heavily
armed checkpoints on the way into the
city some with roadblocks some with
machine guns mounted behind sandbags
some with artillery on the back of
trucks so it looks like even if the
residents of any Willy decide to point
their new machine guns towards the
capital that the Qadhafi forces will be
ready
